Title: Transmission and distribution coordination in power systems with high shares of distributed energy resources providing balancing and congestion management services
Authors: L. Lind, R. Cossent, José Pablo Chaves-Ávila, Tomás Gómez San Román
Abstract summary: The paper identifies key coordination challenges between transmission and distribution system operators in procuring balancing and congestion management services from distributed energy resources.

Title: The Challenges of Modeling Distributed Energy Resources (DERs) as Blackstart Resources and for Volt-VAR Optimality
Authors: Srijib Mukherjee, Supriya Chintavalli, Narayan Bhusal, Varisara Tansakul, Sunil Subedi, Arjun Bhattacharyya

Title: Coordination of DERs for Grid Reliability via Day-ahead Demand-Supply Power Bounds
Authors: Thomas Navidi, Abbas El Gamal, R. Rajagopal
Abstract summary: A day-ahead 2-layer DER coordination scheme addresses challenges in coordinating DERs to protect the distribution grid.

Title: Agent-based power management of microgrids including renewable energy power generation
Venue: IEEE Power & Energy Society General Meeting
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the challenges in agent-based coordination of distributed energy resources in microgrids, but does not mention human expertise modeling.

Title: A Review on TSO-DSO Coordination Models and Solution Techniques
Authors: Arthur Gonçalves Givisiez, Kyriacos Petrou, L. Ochoa

Title: A Multi-Agent Based Approach for Energy Management in Microgrids
Authors: H. Harb, Thomas Schütz, Rita Streblow, D. Müller
Abstract summary: A multi-agent system for microgrid energy management coordinates distributed energy resources to adapt to renewable energy source fluctuations.

Title: TSO/DSO coordination in a context of distributed energy resource penetration
Authors: Michael Birk, J. Ávila, T. Román, R. Tabors

Title: Towards Modeling Human Expertise: An Empirical Case Study
Authors: R. Knauf, S. Tsuruta, Avelino J. Gonzalez
Abstract summary: The paper models human expertise for system validation, but does not address challenges in agent-based DER coordination.
